GT.content: gap (écart) btwn thought, language and desire & philosophy, knowledge and science does not exist, gap btwn gift & economy: resembles an empty word or transcendental illusion
GT.linkedContent: gap (écart) btwn thought, language and desire & philosophy, knowledge and science does not exist, gap btwn gift & economy: resembles an empty word or transcendental illusion

GT.content: perhaps analogy to Kant’s noumenal & phenomenal will help us
GT.linkedContent: perhaps analogy to Kant’s noumenal & phenomenal will help us

SH.content: “caesura is the law”: gathers in the discretion of the discontinuous, in the cutting in of relation to other, interruption of address as address itself
SH.linkedContent: “caesura is the law”: gathers in the discretion of the discontinuous, in the cutting in of relation to other, interruption of address as address itself

SH.content: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces ——shibboleth as the cipher of the cipher: ciphered manifestation of the cipher, emerges from nonmeaning, and keeps itself in reserve
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces ——shibboleth as the cipher of the cipher: ciphered manifestation of the cipher, emerges from nonmeaning, and keeps itself in reserve

SH.content: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]
SH.linkedContent: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]

SH.content: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping

SH.content: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language
SH.linkedContent: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language

DST.content: imprint and caesura, sharp-edged signature (empreinte et césure, la signature aiguë), interrupts most powerful filiations > ineluctably: when tradition can’t secure what it repeats as its own traditionality (exemplarity, repetition, identification, imitation)
DST.linkedContent: imprint and caesura, sharp-edged signature (empreinte et césure, la signature aiguë), interrupts most powerful filiations > ineluctably: when tradition can’t secure what it repeats as its own traditionality (exemplarity, repetition, identification, imitation)

DST.content: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic
DST.linkedContent: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic

DST.content: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]
DST.linkedContent: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

PIO.content: invention only by recourse to lexicon, syntactical rules, prevailing code—a certain submission to conventions (a given configuration)
PIO.linkedContent: invention only by recourse to lexicon, syntactical rules, prevailing code—a certain submission to conventions (a given configuration)

PIO.content: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; the “coming,” the venire, the event of novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same
PIO.linkedContent: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; the “coming,” the venire, the event of novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same

C.content: hiatus of series scores out (rature), in serial interlacing, reference to the other (I have called this seriature [cf. ATM]), to the other’s other > simulacrum of reference, supplementary folds
C.linkedContent: hiatus of series scores out (rature), in serial interlacing, reference to the other (I have called this seriature [cf. ATM]), to the other’s other > simulacrum of reference, supplementary folds

AD.content: Levinas’ ContraDiction, intimate caesura but also respiration of saying > non-dialectizable justice
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ ContraDiction, intimate caesura but also respiration of saying > non-dialectizable justice
